JUDGES: András Sajó;David Thór Björgvinsson;Françoise Tulkens;Giorgio Malinverni;Guido Raimondi;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by Mr J. Palatinus , a lawyer practising in PERSON . When introducing the application , the applicant was serving a sentence in FAC . The respondent Government were represented by Mr L. GPE , Agent , ORG and ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the ORG imposed on the applicant a cumulative sentence of DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . This sentence corresponded to his convictions for the offences of abuse of firearms , forging documents , robbery , assault on an official person and escape from detention .

In DATE the applicant was serving his sentence in FAC . CARDINAL DATE he was treated at FAC , where his left leg was operated on DATE . On DATE , while he was waiting for transport back to ORG , a penitentiary officer handcuffed him to a pipe of ORG heating system situated in the corridor . The applicant states that he had to wait in this position for TIME , during which time he could not properly sit down , drink or go to the toilet , was mocked by the passers - by , and his freshly operated leg was hurting badly .

On DATE he filed a complaint with the prosecution authorities . Having investigated the incident , on DATE ORG issued a memorandum in which it stated that the measure , not denied by the FAC administration , was unlawful and might be capable of leading to a violation of LAW or Punishment .
Subsequently , ORG instituted an investigation for abuse of official power .

After remittals , on DATE ORG discontinued the investigation . Relying on testimonies given by witnesses , documentary and medical evidence , and an experiment , ORG held that – although the findings of fact corroborated the applicant ’s complaint , and the officer in charge had already been sanctioned in disciplinary proceedings – it could not be proven that the applicant was subjected to the impugned measure with an intention to cause him unlawful disadvantage , which was a sine qua non condition of the offence of abuse of official power . On DATE the Military Chief Public Prosecutor ’s Office dismissed the applicant ’s complaint .

The applicant did not file a private bill of indictment under section CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure against the penitentiary officer responsible , nor did he file with the investigating judge a request , under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Code , for the resumption of the criminal proceedings in pursuit of his allegations .

On DATE the Pest County Regional Court acknowledged , in a judgment adopted in regard to the applicant ’s civil action for compensation against FAC , that the measure applied to him had been unlawful and amounted to inhuman treatment and awarded him MONEY ( CARDINAL ) plus accrued interests in compensation . The appeal proceedings are still pending .
